description.narrative: By 2020, technical ministries and the private sector have enhanced capacity to deliver basic water, sanitation and hygiene services that are equitable, innovative, sustainable and accessible to households living in targeted areas, which contributes to Environmental Sustainability, Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end 2020, women, adolescents and children including the most vulnerable utilize equitable and sustainable WASH services in rural areas in times of stability and crisis.

description.narrative: At least 2,700 additional people gained access to an improved water source and are free from fecal and priority chemical contamination at community level, and an additional 11,460 pupils have access to improved WASH services at pre-primary and primary schools. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:09/02/2020
